question_text: FR 1701: Which statement best captures the rule on Internal Audit meaning and responsibility?
option_a: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_b: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_c: Internal Audit is a managerial control that measures/evaluates effectiveness of Internal Control system
option_d: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
explanation: FR 1701 emphasises that Internal Audit is a managerial control that measures/evaluates effectiveness of Internal Control system.

question_text: FR 1702 focuses on what requirement regarding Placement of competent accountant for IA units?
option_a: Accountant-General ensures suitably competent Accountant placed directly in charge of Internal Audit Units
option_b: Internal Auditors may be assigned routine accounting duties to cover staff shortages.
option_c: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_d: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
explanation: FR 1702 emphasises that Accountant-General ensures suitably competent Accountant placed directly in charge of Internal Audit Units.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1703 about Reporting lines and programme of audit?
option_a: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_b: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
option_c: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_d: Issues special reports on irregularity, procedure weakness, inattention to Auditor-General reports, or earlier IA reports
explanation: FR 1703 emphasises that Issues special reports on irregularity, procedure weakness, inattention to Auditor-General reports, or earlier IA reports.

question_text: FR 1704 addresses which key control on Annual audit programme scope?
option_a: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_b: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_c: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_d: Programme covers safeguards against fraud/loss, revenue control, expenditure control, stores control, verification of cash/stores/assets, accuracy of records
explanation: FR 1704 emphasises that Programme covers safeguards against fraud/loss, revenue control, expenditure control, stores control, verification of cash/stores/assets, accuracy of records.

question_text: FR 1705: Which statement best captures the rule on Pre-payment audit and 48-hour rule?
option_a: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_b: Internal Auditors may be assigned routine accounting duties to cover staff shortages.
option_c: Vouchers must not be held in IA Unit for more than 48 hours
option_d: Only sample-based (10%) pre-payment audit is required for checked vouchers.
explanation: FR 1705 emphasises that Vouchers must not be held in IA Unit for more than 48 hours.

question_text: FR 1706 focuses on what requirement regarding Periodic IA reports and content?
option_a: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_b: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_c: IA produces monthly, quarterly and half-yearly reports to Accounting Officer with copies to AG and Auditor-General
option_d: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
explanation: FR 1706 emphasises that IA produces monthly, quarterly and half-yearly reports to Accounting Officer with copies to AG and Auditor-General.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1707 about Register to track audit progress?
option_a: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_b: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
option_c: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_d: Head IA maintains under personal control a register to record progress of the audit
explanation: FR 1707 emphasises that Head IA maintains under personal control a register to record progress of the audit.

question_text: FR 1708 addresses which key control on Internal audit instructions?
option_a: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_b: Head IA draws up detailed IA instructions for staff; comprehensive amplification of audit guide
option_c: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_d: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
explanation: FR 1708 emphasises that Head IA draws up detailed IA instructions for staff; comprehensive amplification of audit guide.

question_text: FR 1709: Which statement best captures the rule on Independence of IA staff?
option_a: IA staff shall not be employed on accounting duties within the ministry/unit
option_b: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_c: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_d: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
explanation: FR 1709 emphasises that IA staff shall not be employed on accounting duties within the ministry/unit.

question_text: FR 1710 focuses on what requirement regarding Internal audit stamps as security instruments?
option_a: IA certification is through Internal Audit stamps
option_b: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_c: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_d: Internal Auditors may be assigned routine accounting duties to cover staff shortages.
explanation: FR 1710 emphasises that IA certification is through Internal Audit stamps.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1711 about Eligibility and application for audit stamps?
option_a: Application signed by Head IA and countersigned by Accounting Officer; Head IA collects stamps from AG
option_b: Internal Audit certification must be by handwritten endorsement only.
option_c: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
option_d: Passport photographs are optional if specimen signatures are provided.
explanation: FR 1711 emphasises that Application signed by Head IA and countersigned by Accounting Officer; Head IA collects stamps from AG.

question_text: FR 1712 addresses which key control on Daily custody and register for audit stamps?
option_a: Vouchers may be held in Internal Audit until month-end to reduce paperwork.
option_b: Daily issue/return need not be recorded if stamps are numbered.
option_c: Released next day; daily issue/return recorded in Daily Release of Audit Stamps Register
option_d: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
explanation: FR 1712 emphasises that Released next day; daily issue/return recorded in Daily Release of Audit Stamps Register.

question_text: FR 1713: Which statement best captures the rule on Non-transferability and return of stamps?
option_a: Audit stamps are not transferable
option_b: Returned stamps may be re-issued to another officer after endorsement by Head of Internal Audit.
option_c: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
option_d: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
explanation: FR 1713 emphasises that Audit stamps are not transferable.

question_text: FR 1714 focuses on what requirement regarding Sanctions for loss of audit stamp?
option_a: Internal Auditors may be assigned routine accounting duties to cover staff shortages.
option_b: Internal auditor who loses an audit stamp through negligence bears maximum penalty of surcharge or replacement cost as confirmed by Accountant-General
option_c: Loss of an audit stamp attracts only a written warning regardless of negligence.
option_d: Replacement cost is borne by the ministry, not the officer, in all cases.
explanation: FR 1714 emphasises that Internal auditor who loses an audit stamp through negligence bears maximum penalty of surcharge or replacement cost as confirmed by Accountant-General.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1715 about Access rights of Internal Auditor?
option_a: Internal Audit replaces normal departmental checks once the unit exists.
option_b: Internal Auditor has free access at reasonable times to stores and store records for independent audit
option_c: Audit stamps may be shared among auditors to speed up certification.
option_d: Internal Auditors may be assigned routine accounting duties to cover staff shortages.
explanation: FR 1715 emphasises that Internal Auditor has free access at reasonable times to stores and store records for independent audit.

question_text: FR 1801 addresses which key control on Annual boards of survey (domestic)?
option_a: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
option_b: Reports of Boards of Survey may be submitted within six weeks after the survey.
option_c: Director, Treasury Inspectorate Dept (OAGF) convenes annual boards; calls for cash offices list by first week Aug; Accounting Officers send info by first week Oct; Director appoints members and advises AOs
option_d: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
explanation: FR 1801 emphasises that Director, Treasury Inspectorate Dept (OAGF) convenes annual boards; calls for cash offices list by first week Aug; Accounting Officers send info by first week Oct; Director appoints members and advises AOs.

question_text: FR 1802: Which statement best captures the rule on Annual boards of survey (missions overseas)?
option_a: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
option_b: Annual surveys for missions overseas are convened by the Accountant-General, not Heads of Mission.
option_c: Annual boards for missions overseas on cash/bank/stamps held; Head of Mission convenes
option_d: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
explanation: FR 1802 emphasises that Annual boards for missions overseas on cash/bank/stamps held; Head of Mission convenes.

question_text: FR 1803 focuses on what requirement regarding Surprise boards of survey (domestic)?
option_a: Once in each of first three quarters; not necessarily end of month/quarter
option_b: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
option_c: The appointment of surprise Boards may be openly announced for transparency.
option_d: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
explanation: FR 1803 emphasises that Once in each of first three quarters; not necessarily end of month/quarter.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1804 about Surprise boards of survey (missions overseas)?
option_a: Surprise boards at missions overseas three times each year; Head of Mission convenes; held at intervals as 1803
option_b: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
option_c: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
option_d: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
explanation: FR 1804 emphasises that Surprise boards at missions overseas three times each year; Head of Mission convenes; held at intervals as 1803.

question_text: FR 1805 addresses which key control on Composition and conduct of board?
option_a: A Board of Survey may be constituted with members below GL.08 if supervised.
option_b: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
option_c: President GL10+; other members not below GL08; cash office officer present
option_d: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
explanation: FR 1805 emphasises that President GL10+; other members not below GL08; cash office officer present.

question_text: FR 1806: Which statement best captures the rule on Suspension of cash transactions during survey?
option_a: No cash transactions between year-end close and time of survey
option_b: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
option_c: Cash transactions may occur between year-end close and survey if countersigned by the Board.
option_d: Reports of Boards of Survey may be submitted within six weeks after the survey.
explanation: FR 1806 emphasises that No cash transactions between year-end close and time of survey.

question_text: FR 1807 focuses on what requirement regarding Certification and treatment of surplus/shortage?
option_a: Board checks cash book and stamp registers; verifies cash book balance with actual cash and stamps
option_b: Reports of Boards of Survey may be submitted within six weeks after the survey.
option_c: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
option_d: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
explanation: FR 1807 emphasises that Board checks cash book and stamp registers; verifies cash book balance with actual cash and stamps.

question_text: Which requirement is explicitly stated in FR 1808 about Board report TF42 and timelines?
option_a: Only the President signs the report; other members need not sign.
option_b: President forwards not later than two weeks after survey to AG who transmits copies to Auditor-General and Accounting Officer
option_c: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
option_d: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
explanation: FR 1808 emphasises that President forwards not later than two weeks after survey to AG who transmits copies to Auditor-General and Accounting Officer.

question_text: FR 1809 addresses which key control on Irregular inspections by Accounting Officers?
option_a: Surpluses discovered during survey are treated as staff welfare after approval.
option_b: Cash transactions may continue during a survey provided they are recorded in the cash book.
option_c: Boards of Survey are held only at the end of each quarter, not at year-end.
option_d: Accounting Officers issue instructions for systematic inspection at irregular intervals of cash held by subordinate officers; record kept
explanation: FR 1809 emphasises that Accounting Officers issue instructions for systematic inspection at irregular intervals of cash held by subordinate officers; record kept.

question_text: In the context of statutory fiscal accountability, deduce whether in applying FR 1901, what is the primary compliance objective?
option_a: A general administrative tradition
option_b: An informal bestâpractice guideline
option_c: Requirement specifically mandated by FR 1901
option_d: A discretionary internal preference
explanation: FR 1901 explicitly establishes this requirement; alternatives describe practices not mandated by the regulation.

option_c: Requirement specifically mandated by FR 1904
